title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: The Foreign Minister says the Morrison government will not turn a blind eye to human rights violations in China. In a major speech, Marise Payne said Aust­ralia would not seek to interfere with other countries’ political ­systems, but will call out bad ­behaviour. In a key note foreign policy address to the US Studies Centre in Sydney, Ms Payne reaffirmed Australia's alliance with the US. "In this era of strategic change, the US alliance is more important to us than ever," she said. Image: News Corp Australia
